This game is really fun with friends, and it is fun playing killer if you're not affected by toxicity to a large degree. I had a great deal of fun with this game, but the survivor community ruins the fun. I play both sides almost equally, but no matter what it seems that the survivors are predominantly the toxic community in this game. It's really unfortunate, and inflated egos promote insane amounts of toxicity and discourage newer players from taking up the killer role. I remember when I started playing this game when it first came out and I had killers that would camp and be toxic, then they'd rage or rant about how toxic survivors are. I get it now. I'm sorry dbd, I'll continue to play you because I've already been sucked in, but I don't want to drag anyone else down with me.

Edit:
I also think it's sad that the newest updates primarily benefit survivors. Extra elements to the game that don't work in the killer's favor, and in fact make the game harder for killers (reworks on maps that add disadvantages for killers). Additionally, some new event items came out for lunar new year that just stun the killer. Meanwhile the killers get a skin or two. Survivors got items that directly affect gameplay and make the game noticeably easier, and killers got cosmetics. This bias is unfair and very frustrating to play with. The game can only be fun when you're not fighting the top 1% of players, and it's unfortunate that the top 1% is only classified as players who know how to do generators fast, which requires 0 skill. They don't need to know how to loop or anything, they can just pray that the maps are large and the killer doesn't have movement speed abilities, addons, or perks. Rush generators, be toxic, then escape. It's unfortunate also that the devs support this behavior, and have implemented features in this game that reward this.

Granted, this gameplay and some of these features are only noticeable at the highest ranks (ranks 1-5). The constant survivor hand-holding makes playing killer frustrating and stressful. If you want to just solely play survivor, then you will have fun and this game will be fun with friends, otherwise steer away from killer because the more you play, the less fun you'll have. I'm a rank 1 killer main, and rank 1 in survivor. Please heed these words

Сначала игра казалась довольно скучной, после примерно 10 часов игры игра начинает нравится. Отдельно отмечу хорошую графику даже на низких настройках, довольно удобное стандартное управление. Я иногда пугался в некоторых моментах матча, так что будьте осторожны. В игре есть возможность получить выживших или маньяков самостоятельно, но это долго, советую купить за деньги хоть одного, не пожалеете.

Ігра опредильоно стоит вашево внимания она знает чем удивить и чем огорчить. В игре есть два типа людей играющих за вижевших(сурвов) генрашери и мансери. Мансери полезни тем што тянут время отвлекая маняка. В то время как генрашери чинять генератори. С тимой играть намного проще і інтересней. Маняки(мани) тоже есть двух типов, кемпери і те каториє тунелят. Если ти новичок тебе след бояться таких манов: Дух(Рин),Медсистра(Нюрса),Деревенщина(Беляс). А на закритих картах: Майкл Маерс, Крик(ghostface). На етом пожалуй всьо, спасибо за внимание.

Te adentras como uno de los tantos asesinos más terroríficos y sanguinarios, o como una víctima astuta e inteligente, dos opciones que te darán gran emoción, miedo y diversión. Con una cualidad muy atractiva en el modo superviviente, dándote inmersión a una paranoia total sobre cómo salir de esa pesadilla, y en el modo asesino mucho entusiasmo y desesperación por no dejar escapar a nadie. Un juego del cual el tiempo no es un factor para vivir.
It is a great experience with friends and randoms. It keeps you on edge and adrenaline running. There is some defects with some bad killers but other than that is fun.

A very fun team-based, survival, horror game. It tends to get repetitive, but with a little break, its always a game i'm willing to come back to. Tell me why I get faster queue times at 3am compared to during the day.

7/10. Fun to play for a while. But with the last update the game is not well optimized. Also, there should be a penalization for the killer if they are camping. The game makes hard to level up the survivor rank but is difficult since there's killers that camp generators or people in the hook and people who rage quit. Fun to play but you'll hate the game if that happens constantly. The developers has some things to fix.
Always be a martyr and sacrifice yourself for the good of the team!

Update: 1/3/2022
It's funny looking over my oiriginal review as a seasoned survivor (1600+ hours vs 80+).

The system really doesn't penalize killers playing toxic: you can still accumulate nice points as long as you're utilizing your power for Deviance credit.  With DS nerfed and killers open to tunneling, you really don't stand a chance.  Therefore, this is still an asymmetrical game not penalizing poor performance as a killer.  I do see strategic points of the game where this is valid to employ, but at 5 gens it's just unfair to deny a survivor the chance to truly play.  Create point tiers dependent on gens completed: more hooks you get early game, the better the points.  Specific time durations since last hook greatly effect points rewarded.  Tier out survivor points to leverage up Boldness.  Done.  I love to loop even with the tunnel, but I like to chill and get my other points as this game is grindy as hell still.

As well, survivor DCs have not been remedied with BOT replacements despite having them in reformatted tutorials.  

Lastly, the game is currently survivor-oriented based on adding Boons in an attempt to reshape meta.  Circle of Healing is in dire need of a nerf and I will be curious to see if they implement.

There have been positives such as vital killer reworks, but new killers have become dull and repetitive, often destroying the looping aspect and catering to a more "run away from everything' tactic that becomes laborious.  Blight is the last great killer to be released (and should have been the last).  Nemesis is, IMO, the only one that finds fun qualities since Blight.  Vaccines work better than Pinhead's box as far as secondary actions, and the zombies - despite RNG - are still silly and make me laugh despite sandbagging me.  

Original Review: September 2020
An independent game that has clearly evolved and created something special to share with others.  Love playing with my friends, regardless of how many times we hear our blood-curdling screams echoing off the walls as the Doctor drives us incessantly mad.  

Perk system gives the game a lot of customization depth, a great/varied selection of survivors and killers, and most the maps are pretty damn enjoyable.  The minute being a survivor starts grating you, a night of killing can suddenly bring you back into the game.  Generally both sides have a lot of different tact, yet the mind games and understanding of how to play each role benefits you exponentially.  

The match-making system can have it's weird moments, but I do like how the ranking system operates (does need some fine tuning nonetheless).  The one positive is it penalizes killers from practicing habits that could be seen as "toxic" in the community (such as camping, aka sticking around one "hooked" survivor and not giving an opportunity for others to make a save).  

Based on the myriad of improvements this game has - and continues to - improve upon, I'm certain this is something that will only get more special.
